description.narrative:
EPHRATA is the young organization based on Christian values. Their mission contribute to offer theirs services all groups without discriminated; This present project aims to help the girls facing risk of situation of street, of the districts economically disfavored of Bamako, in the management proactive of the process of recovery of their traumas and their resiliences. The project is implanted by EPHRATA during 24 months centered on the resilience through the games, artistic expression and psychoéducation. This project targets 40 girls of 13 to 18 years of Sabalibougou and Niamakoro in Bamako. Noted the situation of the girls victims of badtreatments, violence and exploitation stays very preoccupying in spite of the efforts agreed by the government and various organizations caritatives. The girls, abusively exploited by egocentric adult people, serve, of hand of work and sources of incomes by the slant of begging, prostitution, the sale and the consumption of drugs. This approach consits todevelop the resilience and heal traumathanks to the games, the artistic expression and psychosocial actions. The Goals are To "conceive and to build an innovative communal program based on strong proofs and on results of assessment.
To "give the voice to the girls who participate in the project while equipping them on the organizational plan and the communication so that they can be a leader in the fight (in their communities and through the medias) against the practices that are the reason of the traumas. To "increase the resilience of the girls that underwent a traumatism following violences or bad treatments in family or in the community during the childhood. To "demonstrate that the training through the games, the artistic expression and the accompaniment educational psycho, constitute an efficient intervention strategy to increase the resilience of the girls that underwent a traumatism. To "contribute to the backing of the practices taking into account the traumatisms and to encourage the integration and the exchange of knowledge thanks to the sharing of information and resources with the Communal Centers of monitoring in order to allow the girls having undergone a traumatism to increase their capacities and their resilience and, so, to limit the risks that reproduce of the prejudicial situations.

participating-org.narrative:
EPHRATA is a Malian#s-founded, Evangelical#s Christian faith-based community transformation and development organization. EPHRATA, which is the second name of the birthplace of the Lord and Savior Jesus Christ "Bethlehem-EPHRATA", is an organization founded and rooted in biblical values and principles that aims to contribute, without any discrimination, to the full blooming of children and the integral development of young people (citizens and future leaders of Mali) in a healthy and peaceful environment. Its vision is tosee Mali emerge as a Just, Free, Prosperous and Strong Nation where the will of God in Jesus Christ reigns. Its mission is to promote the participation of children and youth and to use sport, games and tools for community transformation and development to help local churches, communities, political parties and the state to promote and protect human rights in general and the right of the childin particular. This is based on EPHRATA's commitment to the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child (CRC) and the African Charter on the Rights and Welfare of the Child (ACRWC) and their links with the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. It has been working for the transformation and for the development of Mali since October 2008. Track record of project executed: The "Street Light" project in progress until 2021. Funded by SEL France through Tearfund Mali, the "Street Light" project aims to bring light and smiles to 20 children, girls and boys, in the streets of Sabalibougou and Niamakoro neighborhoods in Bamako. Through games and life lessons, the project is helping children to build their lives on healthy values and principles and to transform their behaviors and characteristics into a condition of lasting positive change. Through a literacy program that will be followed by vocational training, children's skills and abilities will be developed. After apprenticeship, they will be supported in their professional insertions. This will allow these children to leave the streets and build a new life and be able to get married and start families by offeringtheir children what they missed.
CCMP Implementation Project (2015 -2017): With the help of our partners New Life Church and Tearfund Mali, we were able to implement theChurch and the Community Mobilization Process - CCMP- in six (6) rural churches in the prefecture of Yorosso (about 500 km from the capital Bamako). The CCMP is a dynamic process to support local churches to mobilize the entire community to meet their needs using their own resources.
The Whole Life Coaching Project (2015 -2017) We recruited and trained 25 young volunteers as Whole Life Coaches in 8 cities (Bamako, Koutiala, Sévaré, Gao, Yorosso, Torosso, Omasso and Kaye). After the training, these coaches set up teams in their cities. A total of more than 1,500 children have been impacted by this project throughlearning football techniques, teaching life lessons and organizing sports camps. KidsGames events Since 2008, each year, we organize different games for kids. Some are organize with partners, like World Vision, for disadvantage communities# kids. And some are organized in partnership with churches for Sunday#s school children and their non-Christian#s friends to celebrate the African#s child day. Up to date more than 50 000 children have already take part in our KidGames events.
